+
+    /**
+     * Initiates a search and returns a {@link PhoneNumberSearch} usable by other functions
+     * This function returns a Long Running Operation poller that allows you to 
+     * wait indefinitely until the operation is complete.
+     * 
+     * @param options A {@link CreateSearchOptions} with the search options
+     * @param lroDuration The time our long running operation will keep on polling 
+     * until it gets a result from the server
+     * @return A {@link PollerFlux} object with the search result
+     */
+    public PollerFlux<PhoneNumberSearch, PhoneNumberSearch> beginCreateSearch(
+        CreateSearchOptions options, Duration lroDuration) {
+        final Duration interval = lroDuration != null ? lroDuration : DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL;
+        return new PollerFlux<PhoneNumberSearch, PhoneNumberSearch>(interval,
+            createSearchActivationOperation(options),
+            createSearchPollOperation(),
+            (activationResponse, pollingContext) -> Mono.error(new RuntimeException("Cancellation is not supported")),

nodes.bodyText: nit: we can use DESCRIPTION_FOR_SEARCH and likewise for Name, will look cleaner
Can we read this from env variables?
You might want to poll sooner then that?
This checks one path of functionality.. (Create and Validate Response).. but shouldn't we also test that the developer can poll and get the status? Another scenario would be the cancel itself?

This doesn't seen right, doesn't it mean that the poll happens every 60s so if the caller doesn't specify a poll duration, it will take this long for their method to complete? Could you check what is the typical default duration and do we need to have a default at all? Maybe this should be required?
I made it a required parameter now so we shouldn't have this problem anymore 👍
Check for non-null needed here?

nodes.bodyText: How is this going to work.. if you just assign the searchId to a new PhoneNumberSearch object? Shouldn't you do something - getSearchById(createSearchResponse.getSearchId())?
Can we clean this up a bit, get the status in a variable and set do the same this for Expired, cancelled, etc..
I see this is still not fixed
Can't we do something like pollingContext.getLatestResponse().. this is pretty much getting the searchId and querying the sync status api

The activation response has the search id I'm trying to create, so to poll on the status on that number, I need to get that searchId from the activation operation. The getLatestResponse() function just returns the latest from the polling operation, so at that moment, getLatestResponse() doesn't have anything

From design standpoint, I am thinking that our poll result type should be SearchStatus instead of PhoneNumberSearch.. so then this declaration should change to --
public PollerFlux<SearchStatus, PhoneNumberSearch> beginCreateSearch

nodes.bodyText: So if change the polling type as per my other comment, the return type would just change to Mono.just(SearchStatus.Cancelled) ..
You would probably have to change this as well since the pollingContext ill not have the result anymore

nit: can you fix formatting..
private Function<PollingContext, Mono<PollResponse>>
createSearchPollOperation()

nit: can you format the tabs
if (status.equals(SearchStatus.SUCCESS) ||
status.equals(SearchStatus.EXPIRED) ||
status.equals(SearchStatus.CANCELLED) ||
status.equals(SearchStatus.RESERVED)) {
I don't think we should get SUCCESS in here, because that is after purchaseSearch.. but I don;t kow what is the right thing to do in that case..
Let me ask the team about this 👍
nit: space between arguments
why not just do a .getSyncPoller right here?

If you call "getSyncPoller", your test is sync. Might as well call the sync client version and move this test to the sync client test file instead.
For testing async version, you might want to test subscribe function of PollerFux with callback.
